sections.heading: EFFECT OF ACQUISITION OF SUBDIVIDED BUILDING OR LAND
sections.content: EFFECT OF ACQUISITION OF SUBDIVIDED BUILDING OR LAND

sections.heading: 1.   In this Schedule, unless the context otherwise requires—
sections.content: 1.   In this Schedule, unless the context otherwise requires—

“former proprietor” means a person who, or a body which, immediately before taking 
of  formal  possession  of  the  whole  or  part  of  subdivided  building  or  land,  is  the

proprietor of a parcel in the building or land or of a provisional block on the land on 
which the building is situated;
“the Code” means the National Land Code 1965 [Act 56/1965].
Acquisition of the whole lot with subdivided building or land

sections.heading:
2.   In the case where the whole lot with subdivided building or land is acquired under 
the Land Acquisition Act 1960—
sections.content:
2.   In the case where the whole lot with subdivided building or land is acquired under 
the Land Acquisition Act 1960—

the management corporation shall liquidate any assets and distribute any 
profits to the former proprietors proportionately based on the share units 
or provisional share units which they held immediately before the taking 
of formal possession;

the management corporation shall determine the reasonable period for the 
management corporation to continue in existence to settle its affairs;

the management corporation shall continue in existence for so long as it 
is reasonably necessary to settle its affairs and shall then cease to exist;

the management corporation shall inform the Registrar the date that the 
management corporation shall cease to exist; and
the Registrar shall cancel the relevant book of the strata register.
Acquisition of part of the lot with subdivided building or land

sections.heading:
3.   In the case where part of the lot (including subdivided building or land) is acquired 
under the Land Acquisition Act 1960—
sections.content:
3.   In the case where part of the lot (including subdivided building or land) is acquired 
under the Land Acquisition Act 1960—

the  Registrar shall endorse the title  in continuation of  the  lot and other 
relevant entries in the relevant strata register;

(c)  a new certified strata plan shall be prepared for the parcel or provisional 
block not acquired and shall be inserted in the relevant strata register; and

the Director shall approve the new proposed share units, if any, assigned 
to  the  parcel  or  provisional  block  not  acquired,  if  equitable,  and  the 
Registrar shall endorse the new approved share units in the relevant strata 
register.

sections.heading:
4.   In the case where part of the lot involved only common property is acquired under 
the Land Acquisition Act 1960 and ceased to be part of the lot—
sections.content:
4.   In the case where part of the lot involved only common property is acquired under 
the Land Acquisition Act 1960 and ceased to be part of the lot—

the  Registrar shall endorse the title  in continuation of  the  lot and other 
relevant entries in the relevant strata register; and
the Director of Survey shall endorse on existing certified strata plan—
the title in continuation of the lot;
the new certified plan number of the lot; and
the new area of the lot;

and upon receiving the existing certified strata plan from the Director of Survey, the 
Registrar shall insert the plan in the relevant strata register.
Acquisition of parcel or provisional block

sections.heading:
5.   (1)   In  the  case  where  parcel  or  provisional  block  is  acquired  under  the  Land 
Acquisition Act 1960—
sections.content:
5.   (1)   In  the  case  where  parcel  or  provisional  block  is  acquired  under  the  Land 
Acquisition Act 1960—

the affected documents of strata title shall vest in the statutory authority, 
person or corporation on whose behalf the parcel or provisional block has 
been acquired; and

the  Registrar  shall  endorse  other  relevant  entries  in  the  relevant  strata 
register.
